Patch.UniqueFilename: *Set User/Group Owner and Permission on /etc/anacrontab (Detect Only)
Patch.Name: Set User/Group Owner and Permission on /etc/anacrontab (Detect Only)

Advanced.DetectScript:
#!/bin/bash RV=0 REASON="no correct User/Group owner or permission is set on /etc/anacrontab" EXPECT="Set User/Group Owner and Permission on /etc/anacrontab"
stat -c "%a%u%g" /etc/anacrontab | egrep ".0000" &>/dev/null if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then RV=1 fi if [ $RV -eq 1 ]; then echo $REASON >&1 echo $EXPECT >&2 fi exit $RV

Vulnerability.Title: Set User/Group Owner and Permission on /etc/anacrontab
Vulnerability.Description:
The /etc/anacrontab file is used by anacron to control its own jobs. The commands in this item make sure that root is the user and group owner of the file and is the only user that can read and write the file.
Note: This content will only provide detection of the security threat or vulnerability. Remediation must be performed manually.
